column1: San Pedro de Jujuy is the second most populated city in the province of Jujuy
column4: and is the head town of the San Pedro Department. It lies in the southeast of the province
column6: within the valley of the San Francisco River
column7: about 45 km east of the provincial capital San Salvador de Jujuy.

column1: The area has a humid subtropical climate that favours crops such as sugarcane and tobacco
column2: which are the basis of the regional economy.

column1: Municipal information: Municipal Affairs Federal Institute (IFAM)
